page.title: 08FIELD BOUNDARIES
page.content: In our area there are plenty of broad leaved trees,with oak and ash competing for popularity,orchards join some gardens to the houses.The elm trees in this area had been completely wiped out by Dutch Elm Disease,and there is an absence of Pine trees. The hedgerows were up to 200 years old and no new hedgerows had been established for{60 years.}Many hedge rows had disappeared because of the demand of more crops which means bigger fields,because they are ripping out the hedges,this means the wildlife will suffer ie mice,which barn owls feed on,and now the barn owls are becoming rare,because of the demand of crops is larger better fertilizers are added which poison the mice which owls EAT.All the hedges we saw were very well clipped so their where no chance of trees growing to substancial height
